trans-unit.source: Converts a Visual Studio project file to the Visual Studio 2010 project file format.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Conversion.ProjectFileConverter"></xref> class.
Gets a value indicating whether the last attempted conversion was skipped because the project file is already in the latest format.
`true` if the last attempted conversion was skipped because the project file is already in the latest format; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a list of warnings generated during the conversion.
A string array containing any warnings generated during the conversion.

Converts the project specified by the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Conversion.ProjectFileConverter.OldProjectFile"></xref> property and saves it in the file specified by the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Conversion.ProjectFileConverter.NewProjectFile"></xref> property.

Converts the project specified by the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Conversion.ProjectFileConverter.OldProjectFile"></xref> property and saves it in the file specified by the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Conversion.ProjectFileConverter.NewProjectFile"></xref> property.
A <xref href="Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.ProjectLoadSettings"></xref> flag that determine whether the project ignores non-existent .target files when loading.
This is the entry point method, which performs the project file format conversion.
This method will overwrite "newProjectFile" if it already exists, so the caller of this method should confirm with the user that that's what he really wants to do.
The fully qualified path to MSBuild.exe.
Creates a new project in memory from the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Conversion.ProjectFileConverter.OldProjectFile"></xref>.
Returns the converted <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Project>.
Returns the converted <xref href="Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Project"></xref>.
Creates a new project in memory from the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Conversion.ProjectFileConverter.OldProjectFile"></xref>.
The <xref href="Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Engine"></xref> in which to create the new project.
Returns the converted <xref href="Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Project"></xref>.
This is the entry point method, which performs the project file format conversion.
This method will simply create a new MSBuild Project object in memory, instead of trying to write it to disk.
The <xref href="Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Engine"></xref> in which to create the new project.
A <xref href="Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.ProjectLoadSettings"></xref> flag that determines whether the project ignores non-existent .target files when loading.
Returns the converted <xref href="Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Project"></xref>.
Performs conversions specific to F# projects (VS2008 CTP -> VS2012) and (VS2010 -> VS2012).
This involves: changing the location of FSharp targets, and for 2008CTP, adding explicit mscorlib and FSharp.Core references.
if true, make the changes, otherwise, don't actually make any changes, but return whether you would make the changes
Returns true if anything was (would be) changed, false otherwise.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the project file being converted is a .user file.
`true` if the project file being converted is a .user file; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the new project file name.
This value must be set before running the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Conversion.ProjectFileConverter.Convert%2A> method.
A string representing the new project file name.
Gets or sets the old project file name.
This value must be set before running the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Conversion.ProjectFileConverter.Convert%2A> method.
The old project file name.
Gets or sets the name of the solution file that contains the project being converted.
The name of the solution file that contains the project being converted.
